Line 62: Line 62:
===Bridge===
===Bridge===
â
A popular tourist attraction in Lake Havasu City is the [[London Bridge (Lake Havasu City)|London Bridge]], which crosses an 8ft (2.4m) deep man-made canal that leads from [[Lake Havasu]] (on the [[Colorado River (U.S.)|Colorado River]]) to Thompson Bay. Many boats are out on the water to drive around. It was bought for US$2.5 million from the [[City of London]] when the bridge was replaced in 1968. The bridge was disassembled, and the marked stones were shipped to Lake Havasu City and reassembled for another US $7 million. It opened in October 1971. It is a popular rumour that the bridge was bought in the belief that it was, in fact, London's more recognisable [[Tower Bridge]][http://www.popularmechanics.com/outdoors/boating/1277231.html?page=3&c=y][http://www.guardian.co.uk/print/0,,5085792-103700,00.html][http://www.nwamorningnews.com/pdfarchive/2000/March/19/3-19-00%20E2.pdf], but this has been debunked by [[Ivan Luckin]], who sold the bridge. [http://www.thisislocallondon.co.uk/archive/display.var.169982.0.how_london_bridge_was_sold_to_the_states.php]
+
A popular tourist attraction in Lake Havasu City is the [[London Bridge (Lake Havasu City)|London Bridge]], which crosses an 8ft (2.4m) deep man-made canal that leads from [[Lake Havasu]] (on the [[Colorado River (U.S.)|Colorado River]]) to Thompson Bay. It was bought for US$2.5 million from the [[City of London]] when the bridge was replaced in 1968. The bridge was disassembled, and the marked stones were shipped to Lake Havasu City and reassembled for another US $7 million. It opened in October 1971. It is a popular rumour that the bridge was bought in the belief that it was, in fact, London's more recognisable [[Tower Bridge]][http://www.popularmechanics.com/outdoors/boating/1277231.html?page=3&c=y][http://www.guardian.co.uk/print/0,,5085792-103700,00.html][http://www.nwamorningnews.com/pdfarchive/2000/March/19/3-19-00%20E2.pdf], but this has been debunked by [[Ivan Luckin]], who sold the bridge. [http://www.thisislocallondon.co.uk/archive/display.var.169982.0.how_london_bridge_was_sold_to_the_states.php]
